pullRequest.body:
These lemmas should make working with vectors easier in some cases. Check [this](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113489-new-members/topic/Factor.20out.20a.20vector) related Zulip topic.

---

nodes.body: Hi, can you add a version for [Matrix.scalar](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Matrix/Basic.html#Matrix.scalar)?

> Hi, can you add a version for [Matrix.scalar](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Matrix/Basic.html#Matrix.scalar)?

Sure, working on it

> Hi, can you add a version for [Matrix.scalar](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Matrix/Basic.html#Matrix.scalar)?

I don't think we want this, since `scalar` is not the simp-normal form.

> > Hi, can you add a version for [Matrix.scalar](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Matrix/Basic.html#Matrix.scalar)?
> 
> I don't think we want this, since `scalar` is not the simp-normal form.

Yes, good point.

bors d+

This looks great, thanks! I pushed some golfs and tweaked a name.

Please merge once this passes CI :)

:v: Rida-Hamadani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8916720343/job/24488629619)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8916720343/job/24488629201)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8916720343/job/24488629812)
Can you add the `vecMul_diagonal` variants too?
The generality here is a little weird; could you move this to the `NonUnitalNonAssocRing` section below so that you can drop the `IntCast` assumption?

When I tried moving this theorem to the `NonUnitalNonAssocRing` section (lines 1957), lean rejected the statement, it is not able to coerce `x` to a matrix in `x * v`, even when I added the instances: `[Fintype m] [DecidableEq ] [Zero ] [IntCast ]`.
I sorry, I meant the `NonAssocRing` section
That's the section where the lemmas originally are.
No, they were originally in `NonAssocSemiring` I think?
Ah yes, that's right, sorry!
I guess maybe this should be `diagonal_const_mulVec` to avoid confusion with `mulVec_diagonal`.

```suggestion
theorem intCast_mulVec [IntCast ] (x : ) (v : m  ) : x * v = (x : )  v := by
```

If you write this as
```suggestion
theorem const_vecMul_diagonal (x : ) (v : m  ) : v * (diagonal fun _ => x) = MulOpposite.op x  v := by
  sorry
```
then you don't need commutativity.
Thanks!

```suggestion
  ext; simp [vecMul_diagonal]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Matrix): Equalities relating `mulVec` and `smul`
